question: A magnetic compass will show an apparent turn to the north in the southern hemisphere when:

choices.choice: the aircraft accelerates on 090° (C).
the aircraft decelerates on 270° (C).
the aircraft accelerates on 000° (C).

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft in the northern hemisphere is making an accurate rate one turn to the right. If the initial heading was 135° after 30 seconds the direct reading magnetic compass should read?

choices.choice: Less than 225°.
More than 225°.

subject: Navigation

question: The agonic line?

choices.choice: Follows the geographical equator.
Jowis places of nil variation.
Is midway between the magnetic north and South Poles.

subject: Navigation

question: What is the maximum value of dip that can be caused by the vertical component of terrestrial magnetism?
subject: Navigation

question: When accelerating on a westerly heading in the northern hemisphere, the compass card of a direct reading magnetic compass will turn?

choices.choice: Clockwise giving an apparent turn towards the north.
Clockwise giving an apparent turn towards the south.
Anti-clockwise giving an apparent turn towards the north.

subject: Navigation

question: A direct reading compass should be swung when?

choices.choice: The aircraft has made more than a stated number of landings.
There is a large, and permanent, change in magnetic latitude.
The aircraft is stored for a long period and is frequently moved.

subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following is an occasion for carrying out a compass swing on a Direct Reading Compass?

choices.choice: Before an aircraft goes on any flight that involves a large change of magnetic latitude.
After any of the aircraft radio equipment has been changed due to un serviceability.
After an aircraft has passed through a severe electrical storm, or has been struck by lightning.

subject: Navigation

question: The north and south magnetic poles are the only positions on the earth’s surface where?

choices.choice: The value of magnetic variation equals 90°.
A freely suspended compass needle will stand vertical.
A freely suspended compass needle will stand horizontal.

subject: Navigation

question: What will be the effect on its direct reading compass when an aircraft on Equator accelerates whilst traveling westwards.

choices.choice: No change.
Indicates a decrease in heading.
Indicates a increase in heading.

subject: Navigation

question: A ground feature appears 30° to the left on the center line of the CRT of an airborne weather radar. If the heading of the aircraft is 355°. (M) and the magnetic variation is 15°. East, the true bearing of the aircraft from the feature is?
subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following is correct when the variation is West?

choices.choice: True North is East of Magnetic North.
Magnetic North is West of Compass North.
True North is West of Magnetic North.

subject: Navigation

question: Isogonals converge at the?

choices.choice: Magnetic equator.
North magnetic pole only.
North and South geographic and magnetic poles.

subject: Navigation

question: When using a direct reading magnetic compass in the northern hemisphere:

choices.choice: A longitudinal acceleration on a Westerly heading causes an apparent turn to the South
A longitudinal acceleration of an Easterly heading causes an apparent turn to the North.
A longitudinal deceleration of a Westerly heading causes an apparent turn to the North

subject: Navigation

question: Why are the detector units in slaved gyro compasses usually fitted in or close to the wingtips of an aircraft?

choices.choice: In order to isolate the detector unit form the terrestrial magnetic field.
In order to isolate the detector unit form the aircraft deviation sources.
Having one detector in each wingtip, cancels out compass deviation.

subject: Navigation

question: What is the name for a line of equal magnetic variation?

choices.choice: An isoclinic.
An isogonal.
An isogriv.

subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following statements is correct concerning the effect of turning errors on a direct reading compass?

choices.choice: Turning errors are greatest on east/west headings, and are greatest at high latitudes.
Turning errors are greatest on north/south headings, and are greatest at high latitudes.
Turning errors are greatest on north/south headings, and are least at high latitudes.

subject: Navigation

question: When accelerating on an easterly heading in the Northern hemisphere, the compass card of a direct reading magnetic compass will turn?

choices.choice: Anti-clockwise giving an apparent turn toward the south.
Clockwise giving an apparent turn toward the north.
Clockwise giving an apparent turn toward the South.

subject: Navigation

question: Why does the value of magnetic variation on a chart change with time?

choices.choice: Movements of the magnetic poles, cause it to increase.
Movements of the magnetic poles cause it to increase or decrease.
Increases in the magnetic field, cause it to increase.

subject: Navigation

question: The forces acting upon the compass needle in a stand-by compass in an aircraft, are:

choices.choice: the earths magnetic field, the aircraft magnetic field and the effects of attitude and movement of the aircraft.
the earths magnetic field, the Coriolis effect and aircraft magnetism.
the total magnetic field in the compass location.

subject: Navigation

question: The type of compass least likely to suffer from parallax is:

choices.choice: a standby compass.
remote reading compass.
direct reading compass.

subject: Navigation

question: The horizontal component of the earth’s magnetic field?

choices.choice: Weakens with increasing distance from the magnetic poles.
Weakens with increasing distance from the nearer magnetic poles.
Is approximately the same at magnetic latitude 50°N and 50°S.

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft using a direct reading magnetic compass in the Northern hemisphere starts a Rate 1 turn to the right from 145°. What will be the indicated heading if it rolls out of the turn after 30 seconds?

choices.choice: It is not possible to answer this question using the information given.
Greater than 235°.
Less than 235°

subject: Navigation

question: The purpose of compass check swing is to?

choices.choice: cancel out the horizontal component of the earth's magnetic field.
Cancel out the effects of the magnetic field found on board the aero plane.
Measure the angle between Magnetic North and Compass North.

subject: Navigation

question: Compass deviation is caused by:

choices.choice: aircraft magnetism distorting the earths magnetic field.
the angle of magnetic dip.
the angle of inclination.

subject: Navigation

question: When turning right from 320° (C) to 050° (C) in the Southern hemisphere, the reading of a direct reading magnetic compass will?

choices.choice: Over - indicate the turn and liquid swirl will decrease the effect.
Under - indicate the turn and liquid swirl will decrease the effect.
Over - indicate the turn and liquid swirl will increase the effect.

subject: Navigation

question: In a remote indicating compass system the amount of deviation caused by aircraft magnetism and electrical circuits may be minimized by?

choices.choice: Positioning the master unit in the center of the aircraft.
Using a vertically mounted gyroscope.
Mounting the detector unit in the wingtip.

subject: Navigation

question: When decelerating on a westerly heading in the Northern hemisphere, the compass card of a direct reading magnetic compass will turn?

choices.choice: Anti-clockwise giving an apparent turn towards the north.
Clockwise giving an apparent turn toward the south.
Anti-clockwise giving an apparent turn towards the south.

subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following statements concerning the earth’s magnetic field is completely correct?

choices.choice: Dip is the angle between total magnetic field and vertical field component.
Magnetic North rotates around true North showly.
Earth's Red Pole is situated in North Canada.

subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following is the correct conversion from True to Compass? T V M D C
subject: Navigation

question: A line drawn on a chart which joins all points where the value of magnetic variation is zero is called an?

choices.choice: Agonic line.
Aclinic line.
Isogonal.

subject: Navigation

question: What is the main advantage of a remote indicating compass compared to a direct reading compass is that it?

choices.choice: It has less moving parts.
It senses, rather than seeks, the magnetic meridian.
It magnifies the earth's magnetic field in order to attain greater accuracy.

subject: Navigation

question: Deviation applied to magnetic heading gives?

choices.choice: Magnetic track
Compass heading
Magnetic course.

subject: Navigation

question: In northern hemisphere, during an acceleration in an easterly direction, the magnetic compass will indicate?

choices.choice: A heading of East.
A decrease in heading.
An apparent turn to the South.

subject: Navigation

question: In direct reading magnetic compass, the effect of dip is countered by:

choices.choice: powerful magnets
low center of gravity.
the shape of the casing.

subject: Navigation

question: Select the correct statement:

choices.choice: DRC with all 3 property can be used any where.
Whatever be the accuracy DRC can not be used beyond 70°N.
Whatever be the efforts made for accuracy, DRC is unreliable beyond 70° N / 70°

subject: Navigation

question: Disadvantage of Remote sensing compass over DRC is:

choices.choice: Turning errors are increased.
Detector unit is exposed to high deviation errors.
Susceptible to electrical failure.

subject: Navigation

question: The magnetic north pole seems to rotate around the geographical north pole. A complete rotation takes about:

choices.choice: 1 degree each 5.9 year.
3.37 years.
1 degree each 2.67 year.

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft’s compass must be swung?

choices.choice: If the aircraft has been in the hanger for a long time and has been moved several times.
If the aircraft has been subjected to hammering.
Every maintenance inspection.

subject: Navigation

question: At the magnetic equator, when accelerating after take off on heading West, a direct reading compass?

choices.choice: Under reads.
The heading indicates a turn to the south.
Indicates the correct heading.

subject: Navigation

question: The Earth can be considered as being a magnet with the?

choices.choice: Red pole near the north pole of the earth and the direction of the magnetic force pointing straight down to the earth's surface.
Blue pole near the north pole of the earth and the direction of the magnetic force pointing straight up the earth's surface.
Blue pole near the north pole of the earth and the direction of the magnetic force pointing straight down to the earth's surface.

subject: Navigation

question: At a specific location the value of magnetic variation?

choices.choice: Varies slowly over time.
Depends on the magnetic heading.
Depends on the true heading.

subject: Navigation

question: Magnets in DRC are suspended below to

choices.choice: Improve horizontality
To make DRC aperiodic
Improve sensitivity

subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following statements concerning earth magnetism is completely correct?

choices.choice: An isogonal is a line which connects places of equal dip; the aclinic is the line of
An isogonal is a line which connects places with the same magnetic variation: the aclinic connects place with the same magnetic field strength.
An isogonal is a line which connects places with the same magnetic variations; the aclinic is the line of zero magnetic dip.

subject: Navigation

question: The sensitivity of a direct reading compass varies?

choices.choice: Inversely with the vertical component of the earth's magnetic field.
Directly with the horizontal component of the earth's magnetic field.
Directly with the vertical component of the earth's magnetic field.

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft is completing a timed turn in the Northern hemisphere from 330°C to 040°C. After the turn has been stopped but before the direct indicating magnetic compass settles down, will the compass (1) over-read or under-read. and (2) is this error increased or decreased by liquid swirl?

choices.choice: (1) over-read (2) increased.
(1) over-read (2) decreased.
(1) under-read (2) increased.

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft in the northern hemisphere makes an accurate rate one turn to the right/starboard. If the initial heading was 330°, after 30 seconds of the turn the direct reading magnetic compass should read?

choices.choice: Less than 060°.
More than 060°.
More or less than 060° depending on the pendulous suspension used.

subject: Navigation

question: What is the main cause of permanent magnetism in aircraft?

choices.choice: Hammering and the effect of the earth's magnetic field, whilst under construction.
Exposure to the terrestrial magnetic field during normal operation.
The combined effect of aircraft electrical equipment and the terrestrial magnetic field.

subject: Navigation

question: An aircraft is accelerating in the Northern hemisphere heading West. Will a direct reading magnetic compass (1) over-read or under-read and (2) Indicate a turn to the north or to the south?

choices.choice: (1) over-read (2) north
(1) over-read (2) south
(1) under-read (2) north

subject: Navigation

question: The magnitude or variation?

choices.choice: has a maximum of 90°.
has a maximum of 180°.
has a maximum value of 45° E or 45°W.

subject: Navigation

question: Which of the following statements is true of the Earth’s magnetic field?

choices.choice: It may be permanent, temporary, transient.
It does not affect aircraft deviation.
It acts like a large blue magnetic pole in Northern Canada.

subject: Navigation

question: Complete the following statement regarding magnetic variation. The charted values of magnetic variation on earth normally change annually due to?

choices.choice: Magnetic pole movement causing numerical values at all locations to increase or decrease.
Magnetic pole movement causing numerical values at all locations to increase.
An increasing field strength causing numerical values at all locations to increase.

subject: Navigation

question: Concerning direct reading magnetic compasses, in the northern hemisphere, it can be said that?

choices.choice: On an Easterly heading, a longitudinal acceleration causes an apparent turn to the South.
On a Westerly heading, a longitudinal acceleration causes an apparent turn to the South.
On an Easterly heading, a longitudinal acceleration causes an apparent turn to the North.

subject: Navigation

question: In the areas close to the magnetic poles compasses are not to any use in air navigation, mainly because:

choices.choice: the horizontal component of the earths magnetic field is too weak.
the inclination is insufficient in these areas.
the distance from the magnetic equator is too long.

subject: Navigation

question: At the magnetic equator?

choices.choice: Deviation is Zero.
The isogonal is an agonic line.
Dip is Zero.

subject: Navigation

question: How is the direct reading magnetic compass made aperiodic or dead beat?

choices.choice: Using a pendulous suspension system for the magnetic assembly.
Using the lower possible viscosity liquid in the compass.
Positioning the magnetic assembly mass close to the compass point and using damping wires.

subject: Navigation
